title: Which NFL team will win the NFC West division in the 2020 season?
preds: Pretty sure this one doesn't count, but I'll tie up the loose ends.
Seattle now has the inside track following the Rams unexpected loss to the Jets. Seattle can wrap things up this week.

For this forecast I will solely focus on the Seattle Seahawks (SES) and the Los Angeles Ram (LAR). Presently there are 2 matches remaining with ->
SES = 10/14 Wins - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Seattle_Seahawks_season#Schedule
LAR = 9/14 Wins - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_Los_Angeles_Rams_season#Schedule In examining the 9 possibilities that SES and LAR team winning 0,1 or 2 of the 2 remaining matches ->
SES Wins Division = 6/9
LAR Wins Division = 1/9
Draw = 2/9 Dividing the Draw evenly get ->
SES = 78% = 7/9
LAR = 22% = 2/9

Downgrading LAR after losing to the "I thought they were tanking for Trevor" NYJ... to win the division, they need to beat SEA in Week 16 and ARZ in Week 17. Not that SEA has it any easier with LAR and then SF in Week 17.  LAR did beat SEA earlier in the season 23-16. ARZ can't win the division and the Week 16 LAR @ SEA game will most likely decide the division (assuming both teams can win their Week 17 games). If LAR beats SEA and they both win Week 17 - LAR wins the division.
If LAR beats SEA and LAR loses, SEA wins in Week 17 - SEA wins the division
If LAR beats SEA and LAR wins, SEA loses in Week 17 - LAR wins the division
If SEA beats LAR, it doesn't matter the Week 17 outcome - SEA wins the division.

Nearly there,  not sure  if the Ram's  next game will seal the deal, the Jets want a win, or  maybe a record loss, who knows, will have a look in  the morning....  maybe a bit later, but I refuse to get sucked into it

It's Russ.
These are the conditions where he dominates.

With three weeks to go this one seems to be down to 2 teams, the Rams and Seahawks. It looks like the one could come down to their Week 17 matchup. Both teams should win in week 16 (Rams vs Jets and Seahawks vs, WFT) getting them both to 10-4 ahead of week 17. Both close with division games which could be a stumbling block for both. The consensus has the Rams as the better chance to win the division but I give a sligth edge to Seattle, especially being home in week 17.  At this point I trust Russell Wilson more than Goff to get over the finish line.
still favoring Seattle with them playing the Rams at home.

Through Week 14 SF is eliminated with the loss to WASH. ARZ is hanging on by a thread. LAR & SEA are both 9-4. (LAR beat them 23-16)
LAR has NYJ, SEA, and ARZ remaining (assuming wins against NYJ and ARZ) 
SEA has WAS, LAR, and SF remaining (assuming wins against WAS and SF). This division likely gets decided in Week 16, with a slight edge to LAR.
Russel Wilson will make the difference.
Week 13: Rams and Seahawks are tied at 8-5, with AZ at 6-6.

All 4 teams can still technically win the division. SF and ARZ are holding on by a thread and both can only finish at best 10-6, which isn't likely to win the division, but if LAR and SEA both lose out (except the game they play against each other) - the worst they can do is one of them with 9 wins and the other with 8 - very unlikely since they both get to play NYJ. Edge to LAR given play of late. This division will likely be decided in Week 16 when SEA and LAR face off in Seattle.
Big win for Rams; mutually large losses for Cards and Rams; however I think Seattle offense will pick back up
Went to sleep, its all my fault  -  :)
Rams have looked better recently and currently hold the tiebreak over the seahawks. 538 forecast matches up well [1]  [1] https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-nfl-predictions/
Leave it to Seattle to keep things interesting in the West by losing to the Giants!

The Seahawks won another this Monday and have an easier schedule ahead than the Rams.  I'm assessing that if the Seahawks continue to refine their game and Wilson stays healthy, the Seahawks will shortly lock down the Division title.
Rams had big win over the Bucs on Monday night which gave them the current lead.  Gonna be close between Seahawks and Rams.

http://powerrankingsguru.com/nfl/strength-of-schedule.php Strength of schedule is going to make things interesting.   Seatle has the better schedule over the Rams, even though Divisional Odds Tracker has Rams favored to win the Division after last weekend.

Through Week 11. Assuming all games are played. San Fran (4-6) - not likely - assuming 6 wins Arizona (6-4) - Should beat SF, looks 50/50 on NE, NYG, PHI, LAR (home); likely loses to LAR on the road. - looks like 10 wins right now LA Rams (7-3) - rattled off wins against SEA and TAM in last two weeks. Expect them to beat SF, NYJ, ARZ at home; 50/50 with NE; likely loses to ARZ on the road and SEA - puts them at 11 wins. If they can beat who they are expected to beat, and pull off an upset they'll be right in the mix. Likely 11 wins. Seattle (7-3) - should win against PHI, NYG, NYJ, WAS, SF; thinking they beat LAR at home - very possibly win out for 13 wins. Even if they drop one against LAR or SF - they'll still finish with 12, but expect they will be favored the rest of the way this season.

The ‘Hawks had a decisive victory tonight against Arizona and have the easiest remaining schedule in the NFC West. Assuming injuries are kept to a minimum, they should now be able to coast to 1st place in the division.

Unforeseen problems in the Seattle offense such as significant lack of pass protection and a crumbling defense have left me to flip on this one.  AZ will continue to play strong outplaying the Rams for the #1 seed in the DIV.
This race is tight and Rams seem to playing the best right now.  Seattle seems to have the easiest schedule

Assuming all games are going to be played (through Week 9). Remaining chances were computed based upon early future lines and projected lines and the probabilities based upon the projected spreads. Cardinals (5-3-0)
Best remaining chance to win are against BUF, LAR, SF. They look 50/50 in games against NYG, PHI, and (at) LAR. They are likely to lose against SEA and NE. Based on early lines and projected lines - they are most likely to go 4-4 the remainder of the season resulting in a 9-7 record. It is conceivable that they can get to 10-6 with a very small chance of 11-5. Rams (5-3-0)
Best remaining chances to win are against SF, NYJ, and home against ARZ. They look 50/50 against (at) ARZ, SEA x2, and NE. They are not likely to win against TAM. Most likely case here is 5-3 the remainder of the season making them 10-6. If they can pull off a couple, especially in those 50/50 games and could get to 11 wins; but 10 seems to be the most likely. 49ers (4-5-0)
Best remaining chances to win is against WAS. 50/50 chances include BUF and DAL. Likely losses include NO, LAR, ARZ, and SEA. Mostly likely scenario is 2 more wins at most, but 1 is also very possible. Projected final record is 6-10, but either 5-11 or 7-9 are not out of the question. Seahawks (6-2-0)
Best remaining chances to win are ARZ, NYG, NYJ, WAS, and SF. 50/50 games include LAR (x2), PHI. I see 6 wins as the most likely scenario making them 12-4, with very little likelihood of going under 11 wins.
updating percentages.  Even though the Seahawks lost, its because the Bills are looking good.  Seahawks still favored to win the West.
All the teams play each other but the Seahawks play Washington, J....E.....T....S, and the Giants. With a one game lead this bodes well

The Seahawks have the best record and the easiest schedule moving forward. The 49ers just have too many injuries and too bad a record to win this division this season. The Rams are at risk of falling behind, though if they beat the Seahawks next weekend it becomes a much more interesting division. The Cardinals have a shot, but after losing today they are likely going to have to beat Seattle at home and drop very few points going forward to seal the division.

Seahawks still have some tough games ahead and the Cardinals are building momentum.  Cardinals beat the Seahawks in Arizona so Im giving the next match up with them to the Seahawks.  Cant count the Rams out.  With injuries, its looking grim for the 49ers.
49ers have too many challenges with injuries

First chink in the armor of the Seahawks who *sigh* always drop a game to the Cardinals. It was a strange affair where throughout the game commentators continually stated how weird it was that the game was so close given that the Seahawks were so dominant. That being said, the 49ers are coming back and all the teams continue to be competitive. Full-division playoff run?

The Seahawks coaches have learned (finally) to let QB Wilson "cook" and he has been cooking.  There has been lots more passing plays than in the past.  AND there has been a lot fewer penalties than in the past too.  They have been winning even with injuries of key players. I don't see the team not winning the division title.
Still a chance the season will end when Covid overtakes them

The Cardinals are starting to pull things together half way through the season as the Seahawks remain undefeated.  SF has continued to have a lackluster performance and the Rams still a distant third.

At 5-0, the Seahawks are the #1 rated team among ESPN power rankings. The injury to Bruce Irvin in week two has not hurt the Seattle as expected and Russell Wilson is playing the best he has in his career. Next week they play the Cardinals and again in week 10. If Seattle wins this game at Arizona, I'll increase my odds to 75%.
Arizona is playing very well, but has not beaten a solid team since beating the 49ers in week 1. Next week is an important game for the Cardinals.

Adjusted based upon the Rams/49ers game... which showcased a healthy Garoppolo.  Should the high ankle sprain stay healthy, LA didnt seem to have an answer SF.  The Cardinals big win against Dallas doesn't offer much additional data for that team.  The next two weeks will be telling as Conference games are showcased.

Updating - Seahawks have a two game lead.  49ers looked more like themselves against the Rams; however, the second half could have been better.  Good balance of pass and run game.  Move Seahawks and 49ers up this week.
Seattle has a two game lead now over the Rams, so I increased there likelihood of winning. 49ers lost to Miami si dropped them

Both the Seahawks and Cardinals have looked less impressive in recent weeks than in their opening games. However, the Seahawks find a way to win while the Cardinals have struggled to see out games. The biggest games of this division will likely be the Seahawks vs. the Rams, which may well decide the champ. The 49ers have suffered a ton of terrible injuries and what was originally set to be a title-contending bounce back season is now looking more like a rebuild. They are the only team with more losses than wins and have not been impressive in really any games so far. Seahawks, in my opinion, have the easiest schedule going forward considering they have yet to play the Giants, Jets, or Washington Football Team, all of which have terrible records and have contributed a win to at least one of the teams in the NFC West. If the Seahawks sweep the 49ers (definitely possible) and Cardinals (feasible but historically never a guarantee) then they can likely afford to lose both games against the Rams and still win the division. As such, I know it's a little early, I think this is shaping up to be a two-horse race.

It looks like a race between Seatle and LA. Arizona seems like it should stay competitive and could play spoiler to one of these teams. SF is ravaged by injuries and seems likely to fade. It likely takes 11 or possibly even 12 wins to win the division which helps SEA and LA with a fast start.

The Seahawks beat the top defense in the NFL at home, defeated the likely playoff bound Cowboys, and just won the furthest away game of the season relatively comfortably. Their games are not always pretty, but they have gotten the job done despite a injury-ridden secondary and a preponderance of penalties against them. Wilson is on track to be the MVP at the moment and shows no signs of slowing down. If the defense settles down and gets its bearings they should have no problem winning the division.
The Cardinals started off great and then lost to the Panthers (who were without their star Christian McCaffrey) and the Lions (who are currently 1-3). While their win against the 9ers was great, it looks like defenses are starting to figure out Murray which could make the rest of the season rough for the Cardinals offense. Their one positive is that they hold the only division win in the NFC West so far.
The Rams lost to an undefeated Bills team but have otherwise remained undefeated themselves. However, while they did beat the Cowboys, their other 2 wins come against the Eagles (1-2-1) and the Giants (0-4), neither of which were convincing enough to make me think they'll come out on top of this division. 
Finally, the 49ers have lost against the Cardinals (2-2) and the Eagles (1-2-1). Their only 2 wins come against winless teams and their injury-laden roster combined with their poor performances overall mean they are unlikely to win the division this year. In fact, at the current rate, they will likely lose the division heftily if they cannot put together a string of wins against better opposition moving forward.

Seahawks: 4-0
49ers: 2-2 but getting healthier and still looking like a strong team
Rams: 3-1 and have shown signs of weakness... didn't play the Giant's super well
Cardinals: 2-2 and have shown real challenges the past 2 weeks.
Seattle has first 4-0 start since 2013.  Other than some tough division games the strength of schedule favors Seattle.
Based on past results. +4% for SF because of last years win
Seattle still favored to win.  Balanced on offense and defense.  However, the did not play their best football against Dallas.  Seattle pass rush and secondary did not look sharp.
Tough division with fairly evenly matched teams.  Early in the season, so will need some more games to refine the forecast.

Even the German weekly DER SPIEGEL takes notice of the NFL, Seattle Seahawks and their quarterback Russell Wilson now: https://www.spiegel.de/sport/nfl-russell-wilson-darf-jetzt-kochen-bei-den-seattle-seahawks-a-c2b706a6-9fed-4005-ba8a-418adfcc4233
https://tenor.com/view/let-russ-cook-gif-18531433 Negative: Seahawks' defense is said to be a weakness...

Mike had a great thought ... maybe divisional success is based upon the QB/HC combination/relationship.  Quick research suggests that this is actually a tough decision for just such distinction.  However, Seattle clearly comes out on top, followed by SF and then LA.  Consequently, when you dive down to a more individual assessment, Garopolo's injury complicates matters significantly for SF... especially since high ankle sprains are particularly troublesome over the course of a season.
Rams defense playing well; Seattle defense not impressive; 49ers injuries

By far one of the toughest divisions in football.  Too early to break them out.  Writing the below for context and framing:  
I provided stats since the NFL-AFL merger of 1970.  Some teams joined after that.  1) Seahawks joined the League in 1976.  They won the AFC in 1988 and 1999 before transferring to the NFC.  They won the NFC West in 2004-2007, 2010, 2013, 2014, and 2016 = (10/44).  They have the longest Coach/QB relationship in the Division (Carroll and Wilson) 2) 49ers joined the league before 1970.  The won the NFC West in 1970, 1971, 1972, 1981, 1983, 1984, 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1992, 1993, 1994, 1995, 1997, 2002, 2011, 2012, and 2019 = (20/50).  3) Rams joined the league before 1970: They won the NFC West in 1973, 1974, 1975, 1976, 1977, 1978, 1979, 1985, 1999, 2001, 2003, 2017, and 2018 = (13/50).  4) Cardinals joined the league before 1970: They won the NFC East in 1974 and 1975, and the NFC West in 2008, 2009, and 2015 = (5/50)
Used the odds from this website: https://www.sportsbettingdime.com/nfl/divisional-odds/#NFCWest

This is by far the most competitive division in the NFL right now. The only loss after 2 weeks comes from a divisional game where one team had to lose. They are currently undefeated against all other divisions.
Starting from the bottom, the 49ers suffered a lot of injuries last Sunday that could have long-term consequences. They already lost the only division game played so far and with a potential ACL tear for one of their top rushers, a multitude of other injuries to key personnel, and their only win so far coming against a team many predict will finish in the bottom 3, the future is not looking bright for the 49ers (relative to the other teams in this division, mind you).
I have the Rams at 13 here because of a poor Week 1 performance against the Cowboys and a seeming persistence of some of their struggles last year. They had a big win versus the Eagles this past weekend but it was far from convincing given the Eagles implosion in Week 1 and the talent in the NFC West. They need to be more clinical to make a real run this year.
The Cardinals have been exceptional thus far. They have the only divisional win, a dominant performance against the WFT, and a lot of exciting young talent. However, they have not yet shown that they can do it week in and week out. They have a fairly easy schedule in the coming weeks, so this may give them a chance to iron out kinks, gain confidence, and establish a lead in the division, but their next real test will come Week 7 versus the Seahawks.
The Seahawks are my favorite by a country mile. The game yesterday was not nearly as close as it may have appeared on paper as Seattle were largely hurt by a dropped pass returned for a Pick 6 in the opening minutes and a host of penalties that continually put them behind the sticks and advanced opponents drives beyond where they may have otherwise ended. They've shown they can handle a running QB (Newton), and ex-MVP (Ryan), and the top defenses in the business (Patriots). In the first two games, Wilson has recorded just one interception (which was not his fault) and an astonishing 9 TD passes and is nearly perfect when throwing for over 20 yards. This will be the team to beat, especially if they can address their foul troubles and heal up their defensive secondary.
That all being said, this will be an incredibly exciting division and, if it continues like this, may be the first example of one division providing both wildcard teams. The teams they play from other divisions are largely not the cream of the crop and if the divisional games are split the correct way, there could be three NFC teams that qualify for the playoffs this year. Such is the quality of the division.
As i stated before, injuries may determine this outcome.  The 49ers took it hard this week.
This will be close. The 49ers won the division last year, but the Seahawks and Cardinals have gotten better this offseason. Vegas as the 49ers @ +105, Seattle +240, Rams +350 and Cardinals +1000.

A win over the Pats in prime time showcased what Seattle can do when they let Russell Wilson loose in all 60 minutes rather than just the last quarter. Five passing TD’s to five different receivers against a solid defense. Only the Packers have put up more points over the first 2 games of the season.

Niners have the most complete team in the NFL. Not just roster but coaching and front office. However their success hinges upon George Kittles health leaving a door open to the other two strong teams in the division. 
Arizona has the blueprint for success in an Uber talented and (cheap) QB. They’ve strengthened their team and will be in the mix with Seattle in the battle for second.

This will be too close to call.  Deandre Hopkins going to the Cardinals, which contributed to their defeat of the 49ers was telling.  The Seahawks win over the Falcons is also telling, though Matt Ryan put up almost 500 yards against their defense--which doesnt help the Seahawks chances in the high powered passing attacks of the NFC west.   Critical injuries of skill players may determine the outcome.
Should be a tight race between two recent Super Bowl teams with the Rams and Cardinals outside looking in.

Seahawks will continue to strengthen under Wilson as long as Coach makes maximum use of his MVP talents. 49ers will be a close second because Garappolo will struggle and last years near win for the Super Bowl will haunt them.

49ers barely missed the Super Bowl win and come back with strong offense/defense combo making them a number one pick but barely over the Seahawks. The question will be QB Garoppolo for them.  Seahawks have arguably the best defense in the NFC West, Wilson is significantly underappreciated and will shine this year with the addition of Jamal Adams.

Basing my projections off of FiveThirtyEight for now [1], accounting for 5% chance of season ending before any division champion is crowned. Also, if you like forecasting on NFL questions, I just launched an NFL and fantasy football forecasting site [2] with tons of interesting questions like: * How many NFL players will have tested positive for COVID-19 by the end of the season? [3]
* How many total fans will attend NFL regular season games in person in 2020? [4]
* When will the last game of the 2020 NFL season be played? [5]
* Will a sitting U.S. president attend an NFL 2020 season game in person? [6]
* How many tweets from @realDonaldTrump will include "NFL" between September 2020 and March 2021? [7]
* What will be the official name of the Washington Football Team on March 1st, 2021? [8] ...and more! I just launched the platform to family and friends and so would greatly appreciate any of you to come check it out and support it. As you can imagine, building a niche forecasting community is quite a challenge, so I really appreciate your upvotes on this comment and support by signing up and forecasting on some of the questions there! Should have a better idea after a few games, not sure the 49ers can make it two in a row and would lean more towards the Hawks this time around...  but lets see
